segments.text: I can't believe the woman hasn't noticed the water overflowing yet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is just pouring water everywhere, and she's still polishing that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is already in the puddle, but she doesn't even seem to feel it.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she's just really focused or completely oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are about to cause a bigger mess, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone turns off the faucet before the whole kitchen floods.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to this chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like shouting a warning, but I don't think they'd hear me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to fall off that stool any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't watch this anymore; it's too stressful.
segments.speaker: PAR
